comment: Professor Ruhala goes through slides during class and then would move onto problem that are similar to the homework. She is a funny teacher, listen to her story time they are very interesting! I do believe that she truly cares about her students and their grades. I truly had fun in this class and 100% would take it again! Make sure you do your work
Dr.Ruhala is the sweetest most caring Professor Ive ever had, easy work just make sure you take notes and pay attention and its a guarantee 100. I would choose her 100 times over.

Took her for ENGR 1000 and got an ez A so I didn't rly care. Based on how she acts, she takes herself too seriously and would not recommend you take any of her classes unless its a class where your guaranteed an A for showing up like ENGR 1000 or ME1001.

Just as she says this class is an easy A as long as you show up, FOLLOW THE RUBRIC, and do the homework assignments. She was also very easily accessible outside of class, and was always willing to clear up how she wanted the project, or assignment done. She gave an occasional story into her personal life, which was honestly rather interesting.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: If you show up, do the work, and actively participate, this class will be an easy A. She is a fair grader. She can be a bit scary at times as she does not like people being lazy. She will keep it real with you, but she is honestly super nice if you talk to her in person and get to know her a bit. Class has 2 group projects so get to know people.
I liked how specific she was with her grading criteria and how often she would give advice for internships.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Good Teacher

Took during the summer, the last time this was a two credit hour course. Most of the other reviews sum it up well. Very clear grading criteria. If you're unsure of how she wants it, ask. Do that and you'll get a high A. Do it your own way; suffer the consequences. Amazing person.

She stated multiple times that we needed the textbook to succeed in the class. I finished the course and never got the textbook. She is very critical about grading and is selective on which students she gives helpful feedback too a. It was a good class, straightforward sometimes it was difficult to get helpful feedback from the her on assignments

Took her for ME 1001, very easy course. I think the class was alright, I don't like how it was formatted with her telling a lot of stories. Homework grading is STRICT so please follow the instructions carefully. Homework is 65%, attendance 10%, group project 25%. Just do the homework and you should pass with an A. Project was stressful, but fun.

This class is easy and informative! People say she talks about her life, but that's what the class is supposed to be about, what being an engineer is, and what it looks like because most students don't know what it even means when they go into it. She doesn't brag in her lectures she simply shares her wisdom being in the field which is valuable.
I loved Dr. Ruhala's class. She is very helpful and will answer any questions you have. As long as you pay attention in class you will be fine. I highly recommend it!

Dr. Ruhala was amazing! I learned about the different majors at KSU for engineering. You learn more about what you can do here. Her homework takes an hour to an hour and a half but it HELPS you so much to understand what you will have to do its practical. The group project is easy but you need a good group so talk to people!!

Her lectures are very easy to stay focused on, and she assigns homework maybe once every 2-3 weeks. Tests are not scary as long as you take good notes and do the homework. She's my first choice for any class I need to take. I had her for ME1001 as well and she was great in that class
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Decent class, showing up to class matters or else you'll miss the homework & won't be able to do the final project. Homework isn't too tough, just takes some time. Classes are a bit long & filled with personal info but are only once a week, so it balances out. Would definitely take again for ME1001

Cons-
Takes herself too seriously. She bullied multiple students into withdrawing from the course. Has mandatory attendance because she knows no one would attend otherwise. Massive waste of time. Provides little to no valuable information during the entire 34 hours you are required to sit in her classroom.

Pro-
She responds in a timely manner.
did so well the whole class and a group project tanked my grade because 3 of my 4 groupmates didnt help

Probably the easiest class I've had all semester, very straightforward with the assignments and grading. As long as you show up, do the quizzes, & turn in the homework, it's an easy A. Also very informative with her lectures, she gave me a clear picture on what mechanical engineering really is like with her experience.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Ruhala was pretty laid back in this intro class, although she does require weekly homework/quizzes. The quizzes are taken after each lecture and summarize what we went over, usually 2-3 questions, super easy. The homework takes a bit longer to do, but you have a week to get it done. Overall, easy course and a nice lady.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: She's a cool professor, and I enjoyed listening to her life stories. The class is not hard at all, but the homework and mandatory attendance is kind of annoying. Also, the final project can be a bit time consuming. Overall, it was a fun intro class, and if you do the work, you'll make an easy A.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Ruhalas intro class was honestly very easy, but she talked about her life more than anything. I did like that she shared her own experiences but it got to be too much. There is weekly HW, no tests, and a group project at the end of the semester. I do recommend her class bc its easy but be ready to hear all about her dog, husband, and herself.
-Best professor Ive had -Strict and can be difficult in a beneficial way -If you want to learn, you couldnt find a better professor -No tests -Graded on attendance, homework, and final project
Lectures are long but the homework is due once a week and is super straight forward. Grading is very clear. Do your work and show up and you'll do well.

She has weekly homework assignments, no tests, and a final group project where you build a mini car and launch it. The only problem is she just lectures about her and her husbands life and then is like go build a car. She doesnt teach hardly any mechanics so you and your group have to figure it out on your own. Shes still the best intro prof
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: If you want to learn and are willing to put in the effort, Dr. Laura Ruhala is the professor for you. She is one of the best Senior Design I professors out there. She guided our team step by step throughout the semester and gave clear outlines of what she wanted. My only complaint is that we didn't have her for Senior Design II.

She is solid a solid choice. Be sure to do the homework, your grade depends on it. Lectures are a good way to understand what your homework will be about and she's always willing to help. Unfortunately, grading can take a while. Usually, there will be one big project at the end of the semester. There are no tests.

Dr Ruhala is awesome, she makes class very enjoyable. She does great at helping freshmen get accustomed to college life. Her stories about her career are engaging, and they help you understand what a career in engineering will look like past your books and school. If you need ME1001, take Dr Ruhala.

Dr. Ruhala's ME 1001 is a great intro class. There are weekly assignments that are straightforward and no tests in the class. The lectures can be boring sometimes but are filled with useful information. The final for this class is a project that was pretty fun. If you do the assignments, and attend her lectures you can expect to get an A.

Dr. Ruhala is wonderful, her class is very clear on what is expected, homework assignments are as asked for, week's notice when they are due. She loves talking to students, and our final project was very fun and insightful. As long as work is turned in on time, she'll be more than happy to help. Class is a great introduction to how college works!

I had her for ME1001 and it was great, so I decided to take her for SD I. Best choice ever. I feel very prepared for SD II. For anyone deciding to take her, be prepared to put in a lot of effort. Work hard and you will reap the rewards.

Her lectures can be pretty boring at times, but she does go off into some amusing tangents. You have a hw assignment once a week based on the textbook, but you really don't have to read the chapter to do the work. No tests, just a final group project at the end. Dr. Ruhala herself is a super caring and learned professor. Take her over Veazie.
Good teacher. She assigns only one assignment per week and gives no tests. Only 1 project which is at the end of the semester. She is very caring and will work with you if something goes wrong.

Dr. Ruhala is a great professor, she really cares about her students' success in her class and even beyond. One thing I don't like is that she talks a LOT, and most times she's repeating herself or talking about something not important to class. There are no tests so show up, do your EASY homework, and get an A.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very repetitive class, but it's very easy to just go with the flow. She's also very particular about the way you upload assignments and grading. The final presentation, you'll go through the 7 stages of grief. We go over topics that don't pertain to mechanical engineering, let alone engineering (a whole assignment over architecture). Easy prof.
I had Dr. Ruhala over the summer. I really enjoyed the way she taught ME 1001; it's entertaining and informative. I would highly recommend her!

This is seriously the BEST class I have ever taken. Definitely take your freshman year and definitely take it with Dr. Ruhala. Homework is based on book reading which the book is about how to be successful in college and your career. There are no tests and no final. You do a group project for the final. Lectures are actually very interesting.

Honestly, she is the best professor ever. TAKE HER CLASS. she is very caring and nice. For our class there was no test/exam just an assignment every week. The assignments are from chapters of the textbook, the textbook is all about things to be a successful engineering student. Take her your freshman year, some students regret not doing that.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Absolutely my favorite prof!!! So nice, good speaker, smart, compassionate. Not a hard class with her but you learn a lot. She is a real human and understands. She doesn't teach like a robot. She emails back very fast. She has great stories and is a true inspiration. If you take someone else's intro class, I feel bad because she cannot be beaten <3
No tests, most of your grade is the homework. As long as you do the work you should have an easy A or B. Ruhala is pretty chill.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Dr. Ruhala would much rather spend time talking about her personal life rather than Mechanical Engineering. I honestly didn't learn much, just showed up to class and did the assignments and I got an easy A. Was bored the entire semester, and dreaded going to class. Try to take a different professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Lots of HW. But if you do it, show up to class, put in the effort, you will get an easy A. Dr. Ruhala is nice. She talks a lot about her personal life, but relates it to engineering concepts. It is clear she puts in a lot of effort into teaching.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She will make you do insane amounts of HW for an intro level course. It gets to the point where you will be sacrificing your other course work to get her ridiculous assignments done b/c she grades absurdly hard. This class actually isnt fun because of the stress she puts on the work. You wont get your grades for up to 8 weeks after turned in. AVOID
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Ruhala was great, a little heavy with the reading assignments toward the beginning of the semester, but after those finished she relaxed a lot. If you come into this class with physics and calculus knowledge, this class will be one of the easiest things you'll take. Just read the assignments thoroughly, she is very specific with what she wants.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Tests? Not many--Clear grading criteria

comment: As long as you put in the work, you will pass. Dr. Ruhala is extremely nice and wants her students to succeed. However, she has been late to class several times and she cancels class if there is nothing to go over. She also tends to be unorganized but gives you the information that you need in order to be successful. I would recommend taking her.

Good professor just a good bit of homework. If you miss 3 classes you fail. Project at the end of the year is fun because she lets you choose the car race or pumpkin launch. My class did the car race and it was a great time. Just come to class and do the homework and you will get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Good professor. Keeps you in check. Teaches well
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--Tough Grader

comment: She's a bit unprofessional because she talks too much about her personal life, and sometimes she does not mind her language. Makes you print 40+ pages worth of notes with fill in the blanks. Does not grade assignments on time.

Eh... I don't think she's as awful as some people make her out to be.  Sure, she talks about her personal life a lot but if you just do the work, it's an easy A.  I learned a little bit about ME, but more around the job market rather than what school will be like.  Group project at the end was fairly lax.  Kinda boring sometimes, though.
No tests just homework and a project. Choose the car launch project if you take her it was a very inexpensive compared to other pumpkin launch. Long classes but overall do the homework and get an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--Hilarious

comment: She's a Cool professor even though so can come off as angry sometimes  and says some funny stuff. She definitely knows what she's talking about in engineering. However a lot of class time is dedicated to talking about herself and although we did stuff in the class I don't really know what I actually learned. Lots of book work and group project.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Hilarious

comment: Dr. Ruhala is a nice lady, but she can be kind of crazy. She starts of the semester BLAM lots of textbook reading and pointless work. Then throughout the middle of the semester she chills out and is kinda cool. Then with just a few weeks left in the semester she begins to go over things you did in August and more homework is given.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Her Lectures are a bit random, she is very into herself, she is an incredibly harsh grader, and she makes demands that are quite frankly ridiculous However, despite the fact that she teaches the class way harder than the other option (adding in entire sections that are not part of it) It really DOES help in your future as she preps you for Statics.

I love this teacher, she was strict but also nice. Do not miss 2 classes or F. Easy A if you pay attention do the homework and don't goof off.  Note: She can come off as mean but that's just her surgery, she's funny at times and can be happy if you are nice. The book  was worthless but mandatory she hates it too, she gives no tests but a project

This is the BEST professor EVER!  She is extremely clear.  Dr. Ruhala is a very helpful professor who helps her students on the journey to success.  She is without a doubt a very competent type of instructor who wants her students to do well.  She is always available for you and gets off her way to help you.  I recommend her, but be ready to work!

She is horrible in every aspect possible. She forced us to buy a  brand new $250 book when every other class used a $20 one. She is so caught up in herself that she doesn't teach most of the time, but simply praises her worthless accomplishments. I did my work and made an A in the class, but I would not even recommend her to my worst enemy.

Class was very disorganized and frequently ran past the scheduled time.  She used a student grader that made careless mistakes when grading assignments so you had to resubmit almost every assignment to be regraded.  She makes you print out 20-30 pages of notes for each topic and bring them to class.  The final project was enjoyable though.

Easily distracted, wild tangents, unnecessary lectures, overly complicated assignments; Doctor Ruhala's class is anything but structured. Choose someone else if possible. Not particularly difficult but you're not going to learn much.

she is a really hard grader. i think she enjoy taking a point away from people. grading policy is really not fair. by missing any homework you will lose alot.  she is sunny, but don`t care about your final grade and won`t help at all.
Not helpful. Very rude to students. She is a hard grader, especially for a class that is suppose to get you through the basics at SPSU.

Dr. Ruhala is a very nice professor. I haven't taken her ME classes, but I had her for SPSU Hitch hikers. She is very friendly and understanding. She wants to see her students succeed and will help those that need it. I definitely suggest taking her SPSU Hitchhikers class
She is very helpful and cares a lot about her class. Lecture notes are online with blanks and students should print them out and bring them to class, so it’s easier to focus.

Horrible professor. I would recommend taking a semester off if necessary to avoid taking her class. Very unprofessional. She jumped around the material a lot and in the end failed to cover most of it. Her quizzes (which take the place of tests) were hard to study for. My class received the information about our final only 24 hours before the test.

Unprofessional, inconsistent and arrogant best describe this professor.  Tells irrelevant personal stories when she should be teaching Statics.  Poor teaching style.  Fill-in the blank notes for a college course?!? Gets confused and annoyed by questions that are not answered by her notes.  Quiz questions poorly worded.  This is one to avoid!!!
Hard working professor

This is probably the best way to get into engineering because if you can't handle her and the course then get out.  I enjoyed her class...though she was not there half the time! He is however EXTREMELY dedicated to helping her students.  Probably one of the most helpful teachers at SPSU.  If you want an engineering degree....take her for one class!

Gnarls Barkley and I recommend that you "run away.  Run away.  Run children. Run for your life!"  Course made difficult because she is too reliant on pre-printed notes and wastes too much time with personal anecdotes.  She appears to get annoyed with students that ask questions.  Aesthetics of work are valued over theory and content.  Feedback abou

notes provided.  industry experience related well to lab portion.  unique teaching style I found refreshing - I was able to sit back and follow the notes and actually think about the lecture rather than scrambling to copy what the teacher was writing on the board (then reviewing it later for "comprehension".  two thumbs up

unique teaching style.  personally developed notes provided that ease following the lecture. quiz/test questions were very fair and similar to assignments - no curveballs.  if you review the notes from each class and do the homework you will do fine.  relates industry experience  directly to what we were learning.

This is by far the worst (and most UNprofessional) teacher I have every had. I will avoid her at all cost in the future, including delaying graduation, if I have to, to avoid taking her for any other classes. She's ambiguous, condescending, rude, inappropriate, treats students like children, late, irrelevant storyteller, an obstruction to learning.

Don't take. Simply don't. She shows up late. Her questions are ambiguous. She'll go on tangents about how she has random growths. She'll bring her dog to sit in on class. I've even seen her tear good, hard-working students to shreds in front of a class. She's a bratty little hypocrite, and I expected better from someone nearing 50 years.
I like using the notes and she's really helpful.

STUDENTS BEWARE! Absolutely the worst teacher I have ever had. She has no respect for students or other faculty. Wastes class time confusing herself and rambling incoherently.  Very unpredictable--great mood one day, biting heads off the next. Gives like 3-4 quizzes and a couple homeworks that are 70% of grade (no tests). AVOID this sorry professor
taking the final exam and we do not know our grade in the class.she stayed 6 weeks on the first chapter and that we did 6 chapters in a week...Avoid her as much as possible....run fast run far

She just come to class for a pay check she does not like her job or the students she should not be in this school at all she insult students every class period she teach of the notes that her husband made for the past 20 years she is late for class everyday for 15 to 20 minutes please dont take her ever!!!!!!!

She knows what she teaching but doesn't go about it the the right way. She wastes time telling stories during class, just about always late to lab. Don't take her if you have tougher classes to deal with and places to be after class.

Great person, but bad teacher... Constantly went of topic and because of this rushed through critical material at the end of the term. Lab was a drag. Insults students for using methods she taught. Grades never given back. Focused on theory instead of doing. She was a great person, but a bad teacher.

Spends too much time talking about stuff...  She is ok at teaching, she waists too many trees and gets off topic. Very picky about the appearance of your work, gets angry if students make simple errors.  Do yourself a favor avoid her for lab, lab reports are way too long and useless. She is a nice lady though!!! She isn't used to SPSU...
